articles.description: MYRTLE CREEK — In April 2022, artist Cheyenne Renee picked up her paintbrush to create a mural in her small hometown of Covington, Va. Three years, 24 murals and several states later, Renee has found herself across the country in…
articles.title: Traveling artist brings talent to Myrtle Creek with new mural

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: WINSTON — A home and multiple vehicles are a total loss following a fire in Winston early Friday morning.
articles.title: Home and multiple vehicles total loss in Winston fire

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — The Boys & Girls Club of the Umpqua Valley has announced the return of Celebrate Kids, its 18th annual dinner and auction.
articles.title: Boys & Girls Club Announces 18th Annual Celebrate Kids 2025

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: SUTHERLIN — No new information is out regarding a fatal shooting Sunday night in Sutherlin.
articles.title: No new information regarding fatal Sunday shooting

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: MYRTLE CREEK — Millsite Park in Myrtle Creek will be filled with all summer fun Thursday through Saturday as the Myrtle Creek Lions Club hosts the 40th annual Myrtle Creek Lions Summer Festival.
articles.title: Prepare for summer fun in Myrtle Creek

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: CANYONVILLE — Umpqua Watershed’s Director of Outreach and Education Julie Lowe had to work extra hard to keep the children’s attention on her teaching instead of the animals wiggling around in her bags.
articles.title: Animals, books and community entice people of all ages to the Canyonville Community Library

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: On Tuesday, Gov. Tina Kotek announced she is using her constitutional authority to call a special session of the Oregon Legislature to begin Friday, Aug. 29.
articles.title: Gov. Kotek calls for special session to address ODOT funding

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: For Aviva Health, welcoming new practitioners into the Roseburg Family Medicine Residency program isn't just an expansion of their services. It's a chance to improve the well-being of their rural community as a whole.
articles.title: Aviva Health welcomes eight recently graduated doctors to family medicine residency program,

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Once a year, Umpqua Actors Community Theatre (UACT) puts on a production that goes all out, bringing big casts and big stories to the big stage. This time around, it'll be turning to post-imperial Russia for inspiration with "Anastasia."
articles.title: UACT goes Broadway with adaptation of "Anastasia"

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: The Umpqua Public Transportation District (UPTD) board swore in four new directors July 21 amid a controversial election challenge that has left one board seat vacant.
articles.title: Umpqua Public Transport District swears in four board members amidst election challenge

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Public Schools continues distributing free meals to children and youth throughout summer break via the LunchBox Express and at several school cafeteria sites.
articles.title: Roseburg school district continues meal distribution

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — While Halloween is over three months away, Spirit Halloween has its Roseburg location set for its 2025 season. Spirit Halloween spokesperson Marisa Simonson said the seasonal pop-up will be in the Roseburg Marketplace, on Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard.…
articles.title: Spirit Halloween has location for 2025 Season

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Zumba in the Park continues Wednesday nights in Roseburg’s Stewart Park.
articles.title: Zumba in the Park continues Wednesday nights

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: WINCHESTER — The Umpqua Community College pool is open to the community Monday-Saturday afternoons. Pool hours are weekdays from 1-4 p.m. and Saturdays from noon-5 p.m.
articles.title: Umpqua Community College Pool open afternoons

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: OAKLAND — The Oakland Public Library's summer reading program event Tuesday yielded a creative outlet for all in the shape of manufacturing a board game from scratch.
articles.title: Children create board games at Oakland Public Library

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Glide High School Alumni will host the all school reunion Friday, Saturday and Sunday in and around Glide and Roseburg.
articles.title: Glide All School reunion is Friday-Sunday

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: According to Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) manager Dan Metz, the incoming impacts to rural roadways as ODOT strives to maintain vital highways in the midst of layoffs will be like losing a dying limb.
articles.title: Bracing for impacts: ODOT layoffs may cause impassable rural roads, dangerous conditions

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: WINCHESTER — Umpqua Community College (UCC) and Oregon Health and Science University (OHSU) announced a new collaboration to establish a direct-entry pathway to a Doctor of Nursing Practice degree.
articles.title: UCC, OHSU partner for doctor of nursing practitioner pathway in Douglas County

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A concert at Millpond will mark 5 years since the Archie Creek Fire, featuring pianist Hunter Noack. Held where the 2020 fire burned 125,000 acres, the event highlights forest recovery and resilience efforts in Douglas County. Hosted by Forest Bridges and community partners.
articles.title: Concert to Commemorate the 5th Anniversary of the Archie Creek Fire

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: GAWSA is seeking help identifying individuals caught taking items from a government dumpster. While it may seem like simple dumpster diving, it’s illegal - trespassing and theft of government property. The act poses safety risks and violates public infrastructure protocols.
articles.title: Green Area Water & Sanitary Authority Reports Theft of Government Property

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man was arrested after admitting to stealing and selling items from St. Joseph Catholic Church. Rad Cameron Osburn, 25, was already in custody for a separate case when police linked him to the burglary. He's charged with burglary, theft, and violating a restraining order.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested for Stealing and Selling Items from Local Church

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Fire welcomed Lily, a certified therapy dog from CHI Mercy Health, to support first responders. Trained to ease stress and trauma, Lily provides comfort after difficult calls and was named Oregon’s 2024 Professional Animal of the Year by the state veterinary association.
articles.title: Roseburg Fire Department Introduces Therapy Dog to Support First Responders
